item.title: NFL Week 16: What We Learned
item.media:description: Diontae Johnson began the Steelers’ comeback against the Colts with a diving catch for a 39-yard touchdown. Ben Roethlisberger added two more scoring passes in the fourth quarter to help Pittsburgh secure a 28-24 win.
item.description: The Steelers came back to beat the Colts, Kansas City survived against Atlanta and Jacksonville secured the No. 1 pick in the draft.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Hoffman

item.title: Seahawks Defense Is an Asset Again in Division-Clinching Win
item.media:description: Seahawks safety Jamal Adams chased down Rams running back Darrell Henderson to save a touchdown in the third quarter of Seattle’s win on Sunday to clinch the N.F.C. West division.
item.description: Seattle’s much-maligned defense held Los Angeles to field goals as the two N.F.C. West teams streak in opposite directions to end the regular season.
item.dc:creator: Ben Shpigel

item.title: Ravens Snatch Back Giants’ Playoff Hopes
item.media:description: Giants receiver Sterling Shepard was tackled by his jersey Sunday as the Ravens frustrated the team’s offense.
item.description: Baltimore made its case for the wild-card spot as the Giants fell back to earth — and toward the bottom of the N.F.C. East — in a rout.
item.dc:creator: Bill Pennington

item.title: With Each Run, a City Shaken by Racism Is ‘Finding the Greater Good’
item.description: The route William Jones III designed 15 years ago through predominantly Black neighborhoods in Charlottesville, Va., has become the impetus for a diverse running group that’s grown since the summer.
item.dc:creator: Anna Katherine Clemmons

item.title: Phil Niekro, Hall of Fame Knuckleball Pitcher, Dies at 81
item.media:description: Phil Niekro in 1987, pitching for the Yankees at age 45. He was known for his knuckleball, and had a career record of 318-274.
item.description: A five-time all-star, he played in the major leagues for 24 seasons, but never made it to the World Series.
item.dc:creator: Richard Goldstein

item.title: Opting Out of the N.F.L. Brings No Regret for This Jets Lineman
item.media:credit: Christian Monterrosa for The New York Times
item.media:description: Leo Koloamatangi at his dining room table in Fontana, Calif., this summer.
item.description: Leo Koloamatangi says he misses his team, even in a dreadful season, and that he has wondered what he might have accomplished this year. But he finds comfort in knowing his family is at a lower risk.
item.dc:creator: Ben Shpigel

item.title: The Warriors’ Championship Glow Is Gone. And Yet …
item.media:description: “We would love to have played better over these last two games,” Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry said, “but that’s not going to define our season.”
item.description: Yes, the Golden State Warriors have looked awful in two blowout losses to start the season. But there are a few reasons for optimism. One big one: James Wiseman.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola

item.title: Jets Start a Winning Streak and Diminish Browns’ Playoff Hopes
item.media:credit: Vincent Carchietta/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
item.media:description: The Jets’ Tarell Basham, left, forcing Baker Mayfield to fumble during the second half. Mayfield lost two fumbles, and fumbled three times over all.
item.description: The Jets’ second win of the season removed the possibility of them getting the No. 1 pick in next year’s draft, while Cleveland is at risk of extending the league’s longest postseason drought.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Duke Women's Basketball Season is Cancelled After Four Games
item.media:description: The Blue Devils’ first-year coach, Kara Lawson, said this month that she did not think the team should be playing during the pandemic.
item.description: The team is the first Power Five basketball team to start and stop its season because of the pandemic. The men’s basketball team is expected to continue playing.
item.dc:creator: Gillian R. Brassil

item.title: K.C. Jones, Celtics Standout as Player and Coach, Dies at 88
item.description: As a defense-minded guard, he played on eight consecutive championship teams. He later found success leading the team from the sidelines.
item.dc:creator: Richard Goldstein

item.title: At French Resorts, Skiing Has Become an Uphill Sport
item.media:credit: Pete Kiehart for The New York Times
item.description: The government closed ski lifts, fearing they might spread the coronavirus. The skiers came anyway.
item.dc:creator: Pete Kiehart

item.title: Petr Cech Is Still Saving Chelsea, This Time in New Role
item.media:description: Petr Cech’s role as technical director at Chelsea calls on every bit of what he learned in the game.
item.description: For the recently retired goalkeeper, a role as Chelsea’s technical director is appealing because of how different it is from playing.
item.dc:creator: Rory Smith

item.title: Jon Huber, Who Rose to Fame With World Wrestling Entertainment, Dies at 41
item.media:description: Jon Huber, who was also known as Luke Harper, was known for his soft-spoken intensity in the ring.
item.description: Mr. Huber, who was known in the ring as Brodie Lee and Luke Harper, died from a “lung issue” unrelated to Covid-19, his wife said.
item.dc:creator: Marie Fazio

item.title: Alvin Kamara Runs for Six Touchdowns Against Vikings
item.media:description: Alvin Kamara rushed for a career-high 155 yards.
item.description: The Saints running back tied an N.F.L. record set in 1929 in New Orleans’ 52-33 win over the Minnesota Vikings.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ‘Stay Alive and Survive’: Ski Resorts Brace for a Pandemic Season
item.media:credit: Cayce Clifford for The New York Times
item.media:description: Squaw Valley Ski Resort near Lake Tahoe has limited ticket sales to 50 percent of the norm.
item.description: Many have put capacity restrictions in place, even as new lockdowns may spook visitors.
item.dc:creator: Kellen Browning

item.title: An N.B.A. Christmas Gift: LeBron, Steph and Luka in Action
item.media:description: The Los Angeles Lakers will host the Mavericks in the Christmas Day prime time spot.
item.description: With LeBron James, Stephen Curry and Luka Doncic playing, there’s something for everyone. If you haven’t kept up since last season, here’s everything you need to know.
item.dc:creator: Sopan Deb, Scott Cacciola and Marc Stein

item.title: Jeannie Morris, Trailblazing Chicago Sportscaster, Dies at 85
item.description: She was a rare woman in broadcast sports journalism when she began her career in the late 1960s, but she helped pave the way for the many women who followed.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir

item.title: Aliphine Tuliamuk Won the Olympic Trials Marathon. Now She's Training Through Pregnancy.
item.media:description: Aliphine Tuliamuk posed after winning the women's U.S. Olympic marathon team trials in February.
item.description: When competitive running events for 2020 largely disappeared, Aliphine Tuliamuk and her partner saw the opportunity to have a child before the next Olympics.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Futterman

item.title: She’s a Chess Champion Who Can Barely See the Board
item.media:credit: Barrett Emke for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jessica Lauser, a three-time U.S. Blind Chess champion, in her Kansas City, Mo., apartment.
item.description: Like the fictional Beth Harmon in “The Queen’s Gambit,” she’s trying to find a way to get to Russia to compete. Unlike Beth, she’s blind.
item.dc:creator: Dana Mackenzie

item.title: NFL Week 16 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
item.media:description: Linebacker Darius Leonard is one of the game’s best defenders. The Colts finally surrounded him with enough talent for that to matter.
item.description: The Colts are favored on the road in Pittsburgh, the Rams will try to stay alive in Seattle and a frozen matchup between Tennessee and Green Bay should still have plenty of offense.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Hoffman

item.title: Utah Jazz learn an early season lesson as they lose to Minnesota in home opener
item.description: The Utah Jazz took their first L. Rudy Gobert just hopes that L stands for “lesson”.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Utah Jazz keep Damian Lillard in check, cruise to 120-100 opening-night victory over Portland
item.description: Donovan Mitchell wanted a fast start to the season. The Utah Jazz delivered.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Roundball Roundup: Dennis Lindsey previews the 2020-2021 Season
item.description: With the shortest offseason in professional sports history, Dennis Lindsey needed to work fast.
item.dc:creator: JP Chunga

item.title: Ryan and Ashley Smith bring their love of basketball and their state to the Utah Jazz
item.description: Life is a series of experiences. In the case of Ryan Smith, experience is life.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Utah Jazz want to 'come out ready to go' as they prepare for season-opener in Portland
item.description: A short summer? A strange training camp? A truncated preseason?
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: 'Where my heart is': Rudy Gobert discusses his contract extension with the Utah Jazz and his hopes for the future
item.description: Rudy Gobert, more than anything else, wants to be a champion. He has envisioned it. Confetti falling. Champagne popping.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Jazz sign Rudy Gobert to contract extension
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has signed two-time Defensive Player of the Year, three-time All-NBA honoree and four-time Al
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Jazz Waive Yogi Ferrell and Malcolm Miller
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has waived guard Yogi Ferrell and forward Malcolm Miller.
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Roundball Roundup: Noah Eagle on Seinfeld, Kawhi, and Jazz-Clippers
item.description: Noah Eagle, radio voice for the Los Angeles Clippers, is the bridge between the end of the preseason and start of the NBA on T
item.dc:creator: JP Chunga

item.title: Jazz Sign Yogi Ferrell and Malcolm Miller
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has signed guard Yogi Ferrell and forward Malcolm Miller.
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Sources: Padres near deal to acquire Rays' Snell
item.description: The San Diego Padres are finalizing a trade to acquire former Cy Young winner Blake Snell from the Tampa Bay Rays for prospects, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan.

item.title: WFT's Haskins muffs opportunity: 'It is what it is'
item.description: Dwayne Haskins, who was benched in the fourth quarter of Sunday's 20-13 loss to Carolina, called the past week "the hardest week of my life."

item.title: Sources: Rams fear Goff suffered broken thumb
item.description: The Rams fear that quarterback Jared Goff suffered a broken thumb at Seattle on Sunday, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter, and that he might not play in the regular-season finale versus Arizona.

item.title: Chiefs clinch No. 1 seed as Kelce sets records
item.description: The Chiefs held off the Falcons 17-14 to clinch the No. 1 seed in the AFC as tight end Travis Kelce set two NFL records in the victory.

item.title: Mavs put Clips in record 50-point halftime hole
item.description: The Mavericks set an NBA record for largest halftime lead with a 77-27 advantage over the LA Clippers -- breaking the mark of 47 set by the Warriors vs. the Kings in 1991.

item.title: Mayfield says he 'failed' Browns in loss to Jets
item.description: Baker Mayfield said he "failed" the Browns after their 23-16 loss to the New York Jets, a defeat in which he fumbled three times.

item.title: Watt rants on Texans' effort: If you don't care, go
item.description: J.J. Watt is unhappy with the Texans' lack of professionalism amid this 4-11 season, saying "if you can't want to go out there and win, you shouldn't be here."

item.title: Week 16 takeaways: Steelers get back to winning ways; Browns squander opportunity
item.description: Pittsburgh halted its losing streak, while Cleveland put its playoff hopes in danger after losing to the two-win Jets.

item.title: Chiefs' Tyreek Hill does a DK Metcalf after saying he would never get the chance
item.description: The speedy Hill tracked down the Falcons' Foyesade Oluokun 51 yards down the field following an interception.

item.title: Spurs' winless run a massive test for Mourinho and his managerial style
item.description: Tottenham are now winless in four after Sunday's draw at Wolves. Can Jose Mourinho get the train back on track or will his style be Spurs' undoing?

item.title: Sources: NFL teams eye Meyer for HC openings
item.description: At least two NFL teams have reached out to Urban Meyer to see whether he would be interested in interviewing for -- if not accepting -- a head-coaching job at the next level, sources told ESPN.

item.title: Music City Bowl canceled after Mizzou virus spike
item.description: Missouri was set to face Iowa in the Music City Bowl on Wednesday in Nashville.

item.title: Villanova's Wright tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Villanova has paused team activities after coach Jay Wright tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Bubba Wallace won't let anyone stand in the way of what he believes anymore
item.description: Wallace has long known he is speaking on behalf of Black motorsports fans. Still, he never fully immersed himself in that responsibility -- until this year. Watch SportsCenter Presents 2020 at 8 p.m. ET on ESPN.

item.title: The grand athlete autograph experiment: Do our favorite stars still respond to fan mail?
item.description: What are the chances that an autograph request in July actually got to an NBA or WNBA star in the bubble? Probably only slightly better than getting a response, right? Wrong, as one 14-year-old superfan recently found out.

item.title: Draft kit: Rankings, mock drafts, sleepers, projections and analysis
item.description: We've got everything you need to dominate fantasy basketball from every angle.

item.title: Why Canelo Alvarez is(n't) boxing's pound-for-pound king
item.description: The ESPN pound-for-pound panel ranks Terence Crawford No. 1. Others disagree. Ben Baby and Cameron Wolfe break down what makes both fighters the best in the sport.

item.title: MMA divisional rankings: A change at No. 1 and several new arrivals highlight latest movement
item.description: UFC men's flyweight champion Deiveson Figueiredo leapfrogged a legend to take over at 125 pounds in the biggest change in the ESPN divisional rankings.

item.title: The wrestling world mourns the loss of Brodie Lee
item.description: Wrestlers react to the death of Jon Huber, aka Luke Harper and Brodie Lee.
